page.title: 04CRANHAM FEAST
page.content: Cranham Feast is a traditional event in the Village.It is held every year and it is held on a weekend.There are lots of activities such as a Fair and Sports. One of these is a Boundary race,developed from the old custom of beating the bounds thus marking the village boundary. In earlier times the party would have been met by the Lord of the Manor who would have given them a feast of bread and cheese and cider. Then there would have been games until it grew dark when all went home.Today the Feast is a deer roast,supported by a fun-fair,a parade of hounds and a mime of the Lord of the Manor being greeted by the villagers and traditionally the first venison roll is for the Lord of the Manor. BY BEN VACARA (AGE11)
